verses.roman:
māvamaṁsthā mama brahman
vīryaṁ tryambaka-toṣaṇam
mṛtyuṁ vijitya pradhane
āneṣye te prajāḥ prabho

synonyms: mā avamaṁsthāḥ—do not belittle; mama—my; brahman—O brāhmaṇa; vīryam—prowess; tri-ambaka—Lord Śiva; toṣaṇam—which satisfied; mṛtyum—death personified; vijitya—defeating; pradhane—in battle; āneṣye—I will bring back; te—your; prajāḥ—children; prabho—O master.
translation: Do not minimize my ability, which was good enough to satisfy Lord Śiva, O brāhmaṇa. I will bring back your sons, dear master, even if I have to defeat Death himself in battle.
